segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5
8. Warriors
79. Future Perils (3rd)

segments.pli: “Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, anāgatabhayāni etarahi asamuppannāni āyatiṃ samuppajjissanti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these five future perils have not currently arisen, but they will arise in the future.
You should look out for them
and try to give them up.
What five?

segments.pli: Bhavissanti, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anāgatamaddhānaṃ abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: In a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā aññe upasampādessanti.
segments.en: They will ordain others,

segments.pli: Tepi na sakkhissanti vinetuṃ adhisīle adhicitte adhipaññāya.
segments.en: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tepi bhavissanti abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā aññe upasampādessanti.
segments.en: They too will ordain others,

segments.pli: Tepi na sakkhissanti vinetuṃ adhisīle adhicitte adhipaññāya.
segments.en: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tepi bhavissanti abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
And that is how corrupt training comes from corrupt teachings,
and corrupt teachings come from corrupt training.

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ anāgatabhayaṃ etarahi asamuppannaṃ āyatiṃ samuppajjissati.
segments.en: This is the first future peril that has not currently arisen, but will arise in the future …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhavissanti bhikkhū anāgatamaddhānaṃ abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: Furthermore, in a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā aññesaṃ nissayaṃ dassanti.
segments.en: They will give dependence to others,

segments.pli: Tepi na sakkhissanti vinetuṃ adhisīle adhicitte adhipaññāya.
segments.en: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tepi bhavissanti abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā aññesaṃ nissayaṃ dassanti.
segments.en: They too will give dependence to others,

segments.pli: Tepi na sakkhissanti vinetuṃ adhisīle adhicitte adhipaññāya.
segments.en: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tepi bhavissanti abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
And that is how corrupt training comes from corrupt teachings,
and corrupt teachings come from corrupt training.

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṃ anāgatabhayaṃ etarahi asamuppannaṃ āyatiṃ samuppajjissati.
segments.en: This is the second future peril that has not currently arisen, but will arise in the future …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhavissanti bhikkhū anāgatamaddhānaṃ abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: Furthermore, in a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā abhidhammakathaṃ vedallakathaṃ kathentā kaṇhadhammaṃ okkamamānā na bujjhissanti.
segments.en: In discussion about the teachings and classifications they’ll fall into dark ideas without realizing it.
And that is how corrupt training comes from corrupt teachings,
and corrupt teachings come from corrupt training.

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṃ anāgatabhayaṃ etarahi asamuppannaṃ āyatiṃ samuppajjissati.
segments.en: This is the third future peril that has not currently arisen, but will arise in the future …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhavissanti bhikkhū anāgatamaddhānaṃ abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: Furthermore, in a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīratthā lokuttarā suññatāppaṭisaṃyuttā, tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti, na sotaṃ odahissanti, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapessanti, na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.
segments.en: When discourses spoken by the Realized One—deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness—are being recited they won’t want to listen. They won’t pay attention or apply their minds to understand them, nor will they think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.

segments.pli: Ye pana te suttantā kavitā kāveyyā cittakkharā cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā, tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsissanti, sotaṃ odahissanti, aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapessanti, te ca dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.
segments.en: But when discourses composed by poets—poetry, with fancy words and phrases, composed by outsiders or spoken by disciples—are being recited they will want to listen. They’ll pay attention and apply their minds to understand them, and they’ll think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.
And that is how corrupt training comes from corrupt teachings,
and corrupt teachings come from corrupt training.

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, catutthaṃ anāgatabhayaṃ etarahi asamuppannaṃ āyatiṃ samuppajjissati.
segments.en: This is the fourth future peril that has not currently arisen, but will arise in the future …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhavissanti bhikkhū anāgatamaddhānaṃ abhāvitakāyā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā.
segments.en: Furthermore, in a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Te abhāvitakāyā samānā abhāvitasīlā abhāvitacittā abhāvitapaññā therā bhikkhū bāhulikā bhavissanti sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṃ ārabhissanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: The senior mendicants will be indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion, not rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
Those who come after them will follow their example.

segments.pli: Sāpi bhavissati bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṃ ārabhissati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: They too will become indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion, not rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
And that is how corrupt training comes from corrupt teachings,
and corrupt teachings come from corrupt training.

segments.pli: Idaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamaṃ anāgatabhayaṃ etarahi asamuppannaṃ āyatiṃ samuppajjissati.
segments.en: This is the fifth future peril that has not currently arisen, but will arise in the future …

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca anāgatabhayāni etarahi asamuppannāni āyatiṃ samuppajjissanti.
segments.en: These are the five future perils that have not currently arisen, but will arise in the future.
You should look out for them,
and try to give them up.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, these five future perils have not currently arisen,…

suttaplex.blurb: When the teachers and leaders of the Saṅgha are not well practiced, their weakness will be passed down the generations.
